```{r}
#| echo: false
#| message: false


# necessary packages 
library(readxl)
library(tidyverse)

```

Hi! In this paper, I will present data from my PhD work. To practice my R skills, I have created a table showing the mean maximal oxygen consumption (V<span>&#x0307;</span>O~2max~) for females and males at baseline, along with three different figures based on the same data. Figures 1, 2, and 3 display V<span>&#x0307;</span>O~2max~ indexed to body mass for females and males before, during, and after 1 year of endurance exercise training. Improved V<span>&#x0307;</span>O~2max~ with endurance exercise training is associated with a lower risk of all-cause mortality and morbidity ([@ross2019]).




```{r}
#| echo: false


data <- read_excel("data/data.xlsx", na = "na")


d <- data |> 
  filter(timepoint == 1) |>
  mutate(vo2.kg = vo2 / weight) |>
group_by(sex) |>
  summarise(vo2.m = mean(vo2.kg, na.rm = T),
            vo2.s = sd(vo2.kg, na.rm = T)) |>
  mutate(vo2.kg = paste0(round(vo2.m,1), " (", round(vo2.s, 1), ")"))

f <- d |>
  filter(sex == "f") |>
  select(vo2.kg)

m <- d |>
  filter(sex == "m") |>
  select(vo2.kg)

```
           
------------------ | Female     | Male 
------------------ | ---------- | ---------- 
VO2max (mL/min/kg) | 22.0 (6.3) | 27.3 (9.4)
